snippet.title: Man injured on Coast work site to be airlifted to hospital
snippet.content: UPDATE: A MAN injured on a Coast construction site will be airlifted to hospital. Ambulance crews are currently on scene at a Riverstone Ct, Tewantin address with man, in his 40s, who is suffering leg fractures and a hip injury. Reports indicate he was injured by an excavator. A Queensland Ambulance spokesperson said it was likely the man would be airlifted to a Brisbane hospital. BREAKING: PARAMEDICS have rushed to a construction site after a man was reportedly injured by a piece of machinery. Emergency services were called to a Riverstone Ct address in Tewantin about 12.50pm and one ambulance crew is currently on scene. The man is currently being assessed for injuries. More to come. Close call for Coast motorists as debris goes flying on motorway Heavy rain misses most of Coast Planning documents lodged on behalf of site owners Five dates through August for community to have its say on rock wall Sunshine Coast Jazz Club is set to present Diamonds of Swing Caloundra Chorale and Theatre Co is gearing up for The Secret Garden Box of Birds art exhibition is coming to Art Nuvo, Buderim *WARNING this story contains spoilers* TARA Reid reveals what's coming in the next installment of TV movie. Farmer's brave decision has cost him the game. "It didn't seem like they were having a crazy, big night." The news came after the couple attended Splendour in the Grass An intimate safari is on the couple's agenda Garth Prowd's vision made huge impact on Sunshine Coast community Home sells in just one day Winners in Master Builders regional housing and construction awards Ray and Gert will celebrate 70 years of marrive this week
